Task 01-02.title: Grounding DINO Sam
Task 01-02.short_desc: The team tested GroundingDINO with SAM for improved image segmentation in disaster response, urban planning, and environmental monitoring. Despite extensive testing, the highest mean IoU score was 0.46, indicating a need for further refinement. Challenges included the model's generalist nature and diverse roof structures, leading to discontinuation after initial testing.

Task 01-03.title: YOLO with Segment Anything Model
Task 01-03.short_desc: This task explores training YOLOv8 and YOLOv9 for object segmentation, integrating them with SAM for enhanced performance. By converting image and label formats and splitting datasets, we achieved efficient detection and precise segmentation, showcasing the robust capabilities of these models in various applications.

Task 01-04.title: Fast Segment Anything Model (FastSAM)
Task 01-04.short_desc: The Fast Segment Anything Model(FastSAM) is a CNN Segment Anything Model trained using only 2% of the SA-1B dataset published by SAM authors. FastSAM achieves comparable performance with the SAM method at 50x higher run-time speed.

Task 01-05.title: GNN-Based Multimodal
Task 01-05.short_desc: This task sought space for different models that were not being used throughout the project and raised tests on the model that seemed more feasible time-wise. Four main research areas were encountered: Multi-Agents + SAM, LTCNs, GNNs, and VLMs.  The model that has proven to be ready to use is the Graph Neural Networks, which enabled our team to make initial tests.
